properties.Name: Lupote Clinic
properties.Activity: Sabona contracted a doctor to bring essential medication to the community, which has greatly alleviated the challenges faced by local clinics that often lack supplies. This initiative has been especially beneficial for the elderly, who previously had to travel long distances to access medical care in the nearest town. By providing on-site medical support and necessary medications, Sabona has improved healthcare accessibility for vulnerable populations, enhancing their overall health and well-being.

properties.Name: Mpilo Hospital
properties.Activity: Sabona implemented a leap learning program in the pediatric ward, providing hospitalized children with access to educational tablets. This initiative allows the children to engage with fun, interactive learning materials, ensuring they don't fall behind in their education during their hospital stay. By combining education with entertainment, the program helps to improve the children's overall well-being and makes their time in the hospital more enjoyable and productive.

properties.Name: Fatima Clinic
properties.Activity: The Sabona Trust's mother's shelter has greatly benefited rural communities by providing pregnant women living far from clinics with a safe place to stay as they approach labor. This initiative has significantly reduced unsafe home births, ensuring that mothers have immediate access to medical care when needed. By fostering a supportive environment, the shelter not only enhances maternal and infant health outcomes but also encourages more women to seek professional assistance during childbirth, ultimately improving the overall well-being of the community.
